Hi,

I am trying to use DirectorySuiteBuilder from junit-addons to avoid hardcoding 
my test class names in my suite.  I would like to be able make this suite 
portable.  In other words, I'd like be able to run it in an IDE, or to run it 
from Ant/Maven, and want to be able to run it even if the project is installed 
in a different directory on a different machine.

Since DirectorySuiteBuilder wants to have an path or File to start recursing on, 
I'm not sure how to do this.

I could probably make the user define MYPROJECT_HOME and hardcode the root of my 
project, then write some code to look this up and base the DirectorySuiteBuilder 
path on this.  However, I'd like to avoid that if I could.

Does anyone have a good solution to this problem?

Thanks,
Chad
